comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message when a user chooses to skip copying a folder. The description will appear in a conflict resolution dialog that prompts users to decide whether to keep or delete conflicting files and folders. Translators should provide a clear and concise message that indicates no folder will be copied as the result of this action.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Kansioita ei kopioida' is a literal translation and may not be the most natural phrasing in Finnish. A more idiomatic translation emphasizing that no folders will be copied would be better.
The word 'ກ໊ອບີ້' is a transliteration and might not be the most natural or accurate term for 'copied' in Lao. While understandable, it's not ideal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ປ່ຽນເປັນ 'ຖ່າຍ' (thai) or 'ຜະລິດ' (phalit) for a more natural translation of 'copied'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation uses the plural verb form 'vor fi' (will be) with the singular noun 'folder' (folder). The correct form should agree with the singular subject.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Nici-un folder nu va fi copiat

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'කිසිදු ෆෝල්ඩරයක් පිටපත් කරනු නොලැබේ.' is a bit too formal and literal. A more natural and concise translation would be better.

The translation 'Nebude skopírovaný žiadny priečinok' is technically correct, but sounds overly formal and slightly awkward in common usage. A more natural Slovak equivalent would be 'Žiadny priečinok nebude skopírovaný' or 'Nebude sa kopírovať žiaden priečinok'.

The translation 'Ниједан фолдер неће бити копиран' is technically correct but sounds slightly unnatural in modern Serbian. 'Ниједан' implies 'not a single' and is a bit formal/archaic in this context. A more natural phrasing would be 'Фолдер неће бити копиран' or 'Никакав фолдер неће бити копиран'.

The Serbian translation 'Nijedan folder neće biti kopiran' is a literal translation and while grammatically correct, it sounds unnatural in Serbian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Niti jedan folder neće biti kopiran' or 'Folderi neće biti kopirani'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Niti jedan folder neće biti kopiran

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'kopyalanmayacak' is misspelled. The correct spelling is 'kopyalanmayacak'.

The translation '没有文件夹将会被复制' is technically correct but sounds overly formal and slightly awkward in Chinese. It uses a passive voice construction ('将会被复制') that isn't as common or natural for this type of message.
